column4: hi all, i'm using an hp mini 110, and all of a sudden, my trackpad buttons actually don't do anything anymore.
i'm praying this is software side.
i'm on here from my hp mini; i managed to connect using just my keyboard.
is there a known setting that disables the touhpad click?
or, a way to check the mouse settings using the keyboard only?
dmesg may tell you if its shut off
my right button works fine
the thing making me think it's not hw is the fact that double tapping my actual trackpad used to make it click.
your computer is just dumb then
ikr
i'm saving up for another one.
i have no normal desktop/laptop, too
i think i know what it is. :(
i think my left button is getting stuck down.
well you know what to do then right?
but it's so fun
in all seriousness though... i don't know much about hw repair. i'm a software guy.
see if its easy to open the thing up, if your lucky, its probably just something you spilled on it and some isophrophic alcohol, highest proof you can get, will fix it
it's broken, actually
i've got proof it does actually conduct.
WANT TO SEE?
X Event Viewer, it records ALL X events and spits em into your terminal
